CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Chronic Care Program relative to Emergency Procedure?
SRP.A: Chronic Care Program is {above} Emergency Procedure in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Emergency Procedure relative to Chronic Care Program?
SRP.A: Emergency Procedure is {below} Chronic Care Program in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total average treatment cost?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Chronic Care Program}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total average treatment cost?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Emergency Procedure}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Emergency Procedure's maximum Average Treatment Cost in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Emergency Procedure's maximum Average Treatment Cost is in {2002}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Chronic Care Program's maximum Average Treatment Cost in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Chronic Care Program's maximum Average Treatment Cost is in {2002}.

NC.Q: Between 1997 and 1999, was the average total Average Treatment Cost higher or lower than between 1992 and 1999?
NC.A: The average total average treatment cost between 1997 and 1999 was {higher} than between 1992 and 1999.

NC.Q: Was the total Average Treatment Cost in 1978 higher or lower than in 2000?
NC.A: The total average treatment cost in 1978 was {lower} than in 2000.

NC.Q: Between 1987 and 1994, did the total Average Treatment Cost experience a larger or smaller change than between 1993 and 1994?
NC.A: The change in total average treatment cost between 1987 and 1994 was {larger} than between 1993 and 1994.

NC.Q: Was the total Average Treatment Cost in 1984 higher or lower than in 1987?
NC.A: The total average treatment cost in 1984 was {lower} than in 1987.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Chronic Care Program} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Emergency Procedure and Chronic Care Program first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Emergency Procedure and Chronic Care Program first exchanged leading positions in {1977}.
